intro: Clidemia multiplinervis, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. It is known for its ability to thrive in humid climates and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening. Additionally, it serves as a host plant for certain butterfly species, contributing to local biodiversity.
